description: Borrowed from Late Latin implēmentum (“a filling up”), from Latin impleō (“I fill up”).

nouns.description: implement (third-person singular simple present implements, present participle implementing, simple past and past participle implemented)

entries.meaning: To bring about; to put into practice; to carry out.
examples: It’s a good thought, but it will be a difficult thing to implement.

entries.meaning: A tool or instrument for working with.
examples: They carried an assortment of gardening implements in the truck.

verbs.description: implement (third-person singular simple present implements, present participle implementing, simple past and past participle implemented)

entries.meaning: To bring about; to put into practice; to carry out.
